padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">Son-in-law of Claudius; Great-great-grandson of Augustus</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">October 13, 54 AD \u2013 June 9, 68 AD</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">June 9, 68 AD<br />\nCommitted suicide after being declared a public enemy by the Senate.</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">13 years, 7 months and 27 days</td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<h3 style=\"background: none rgb(255, 255, 255); border-bottom-style: none; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 1.2em; line-height: 1.6; margin: 0.3em 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-top: 0.5em;\">\n<span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Year_of_the_Four_Emperors_and_Flavian_dynasty\">Year of the Four Emperors and Flavian dynasty</span><span class=\"mw-editsection\" style=\"display: inline-block; font-size: x-small; font-weight: normal; line-height: 1em; margin-left: 1em; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: nowrap;\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\" style=\"color: #555555; margin-right: 0.25em;\">[</span><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Roman_emperors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Edit section: Year of the Four Emperors and Flavian dynasty\">edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\" style=\"color: #555555; margin-left: 0.25em;\">]</span></span></h3>\n<div class=\"hatnote relarticle mainarticle\" role=\"note\" style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: italic; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; padding-left: 1.6em;\">\nMain articles:&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Year_of_the_Four_Emperors\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Year of the Four Emperors\">Year of the Four Emperors</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flavian_dynasty\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Flavian dynasty\">Flavian dynasty</a></div>\n<table class=\"wikitable\" style=\"background-color: #f9f9f9; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Narni\">Narni</a>,<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Italy\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Roman Italy\">Italia</a></td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">Appointed by the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Senate\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Roman Senate\">Senate</a></td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">September 18, 96 AD \u2013 January 27, 98 AD</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">January 27, 98 AD<br />\nNatural causes</td><td style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(170, 170, 170); padding: 0.2em 0.4em;\">1 year, 4 months and 9 days</td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia\non Domitian\u2019s death<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp;<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"> In accordance with an astrological prediction\nthe Emperor believed that he would die around noon, and was therefore restless\nduring this time of the day. &nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">On his last day, Domitian was feeling disturbed\nand asked a servant several times what time it was. The boy, included in the\nplot, lied, saying that it was much later than noon.[141] More at ease, the\nEmperor went to his desk to sign some decrees, where he was suddenly approached\nby Stephanus:<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Then pretending to\nbetray a conspiracy and for that reason being given an audience, [Stephanus]\nstabbed the emperor in the groin as he was reading a paper which the assassin\nhanded him, and stood in a state of amazement.&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">As the wounded prince attempted\nto resist, he was slain with seven wounds by Clodianus, a subaltern, Maximus, a\nfreedman of Parthenius, Satur, decurion of the chamberlains, and a gladiator\nfrom the imperial school.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Suetonius, De Vita\nCaesarum, \"Life of Domitian\", 17<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Domitian and Stephanus\nwrestled on the ground for some time, until the Emperor was finally overpowered\nand fatally stabbed by the conspirators; Stephanus was stabbed by Domitian\nduring the struggle and died shortly afterward. Around noon Domitian, just one\nmonth short of his 45th birthday, was dead. His body was carried away on a\ncommon bier, and unceremoniously cremated by his nurse Phyllis, who later\nmingled the ashes with those of his niece Julia, at the Flavian temple.[142]&nbsp;</span></i> :&nbsp; UNQUOTE\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several hundred mile\naway Apollonius was giving a speech to Romans. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He paused\nsuddenly . &nbsp;He shouted as if in a trance pounding\nhis fist &nbsp;\u201cThe tyrant dies NOW !\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Domitian had cut\nApollonius\u2019s hair ( shikha - styled like Kerala Namboodiris )&nbsp; to\neliminate his spiritual powers in his royal court .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The\nsame thing had happened to Chanakya .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius just\nvanished from the Emperor\u2019s&nbsp; court in front of all.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The previous night when\nhis supporters were despairing over the chains on his hands and legs\u2014 Apollonius\nremoved the chains in a jiffy , like magic- and then put it back.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rXwckUS-DEA/VwZ7OMRiqiI/AAAAAAABHG0/eo1IUlVq4mMxRQZCNsRBtWKF9zNymUYug/s1600/223F59_0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Apollonius visited\nIndia a second time , he went to the Himalayas along with his side kick nay- disciple named DAMISA ( the man who would be elevated to Jesus Christ in 325 AD ) &nbsp; . &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius went back with a list of Hindu temples to\nvisit abroad. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His first stop was at\nCyprus, where he visited the temple of Paphos in Cyprus having a SHIVA LINGAM .\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; THEY BROKE THE KNEE CAPS TOO WHILE IMPALED ON THE CROSS.<br />\n<br />\nTHANK GOD FOR THE INTERNET AGE<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_120b+seedJryvD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_120b+seedJryvD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now that I say Jesus\nChrist\u2019s name was coined at the First Council of Nicea in 325 AD, the Thomas\nChristians in Kerala are left between a rock and a hard place.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Apollonius came to Muziris a second time,\nhe and his side kick Damisa went to Himalayas and Taxlila which has Namboodiri\nprofessors on deputation from Kodungallur.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only Apollonius went back to Rome, Damisa and his wife stayed back. &nbsp;Because Apollonius would travel to several\nnations .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every vestige of\nwritten information about Apollonius was destroyed , when the great libraries\nof Alexandra and Cordoba were burnt down.&nbsp;\nThe sack of Rome several times with the Pope in connivance was also to\ndestroy every temple or altar in the name of Apollonius .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cordoba had extensive\nrecords of Apollonious visit . &nbsp;&nbsp;This\nvisit to Cordoba was what made Emperor Domitian nervous.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why is Damisa so\nimportant?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because Damisa\u2019s diary\nwas found .&nbsp;&nbsp; He had written extensively\nabout the travels of Apollonius to India.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An author and an intellectual named Flavious\nPhilostratos was summoned by the Queen Julia Domna, who had with her the diary\nof Damisa , she got from a close relative of Damisa .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Empress , a very\nsmart woman, asked Lucius Flavius Philostratos to authenticate what was written\nby travelling to many places mentioned in the diary and write a biography of\nApollonius. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All knew that Damisa from the city of Nineveh has\nfollowed his beloved master Apollonius like his shadow .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Julia\u2019s nephew, Alexander Severus, who was\nRoman Emperor from 222 AD to 235 AD had the &nbsp;statues of &nbsp;both Indian sages &nbsp;Orpheus and Apollonius in his personal altar.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Julia\nDomna\u2019s own husband Septimius Sevurus ( below) was Emperor of Rome from 193 AD to 211 AD.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Novm1NSjUhM/VwbYiGS-P_I/AAAAAAABHHo/YTUJno1S5bAwtvC9UiA0OJMmKu7NBoPmg/s1600/roman-emperor-septimius-severus-sftone-bust-q22q2_med.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Novm1NSjUhM/VwbYiGS-P_I/AAAAAAABHHo/YTUJno1S5bAwtvC9UiA0OJMmKu7NBoPmg/s640/roman-emperor-septimius-severus-sftone-bust-q22q2_med.jpg\" width=\"554\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Julia was an\nintellectual, patron of art , a woman of great character and leadership spirit .&nbsp; She would fight alongside her husband with\nsword , in the thick of battle , during his dangerous campaigns ..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-12vBwkpyPpk/VwbUi3XXXFI/AAAAAAABHHY/uzHHwP15WR4eDGtlE38w6LWIp5ceB4ddA/s1600/4166-2013110B171213_540x360.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-12vBwkpyPpk/VwbUi3XXXFI/AAAAAAABHHY/uzHHwP15WR4eDGtlE38w6LWIp5ceB4ddA/s400/4166-2013110B171213_540x360.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Empress &nbsp;Julia Domna was THE most respected woman in\nRome and people were in awe of her courage, regal beauty and intellect &nbsp;.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0Tr2Rik1rKQ/VwbUNBLj9UI/AAAAAAABHHU/rRr_ISkDUPYv5YlNI78kZdOwSWbKNZlwQ/s1600/jd_GHceres.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-0Tr2Rik1rKQ/VwbUNBLj9UI/AAAAAAABHHU/rRr_ISkDUPYv5YlNI78kZdOwSWbKNZlwQ/s640/jd_GHceres.jpg\" width=\"260\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She\nwas the mother of Roman Emperors Geta and Caracalla. &nbsp;&nbsp;Julia\u2019s &nbsp;ancestors were wealthy priest Kings of the\nfamous Pagan &nbsp;temple of Elagabalus . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her\nfamily had enormous wealth and was promoted to Roman senatorial aristocracy. &nbsp;Before her marriage, Julia inherited the huge estate of her paternal\ngreat-uncle Julius Agrippa, a former leading Centurion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia\n-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; <i>If it were not for Julia, we would have very\nlittle information today about the legendary Apollonius of Tyana. It was at the\nbehest of Julia that Philostratus wrote his now famous Life of Apollonius.[8]\nJulia is thought to have died before Philostratus could finish his work of\neight volumes.[4]</i>UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pisistratus was paid well\nin advance by Julia and he spared no pains to gather information on the\nsubject, for in his concluding words (viii 31), he tells us that he has himself\ntraveled into most parts of the \u201cworld\u201d and everywhere met with the \u201cinspired\nsayings \u201d about Apollonius.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philostratus died in\n250 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This bography book was hunted by\nthe Vatican but was hidden in Arabia&nbsp; by\nthe Pagans.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of Damisa\u2019s famous\nsentences was Apollonius\u2019s own words about India.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\" <span style=\"color: blue;\">In India I see\nmen dwelling on the earth and yet not on it, defended on all sides, yet without\ndefense, possessing nothing, yet having everything</span>.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The forbidden biography\nof Apollonius ( eight volumes in Greek ) was brought into Europe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In around 1680 AD ,\nCharles Blount an English deist and philosopher translated the first two\nVolumes of the books of Philostratus concerning the Life of Apollonius of Tyana..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1801 AD &nbsp;that the first complete English translation,\nfrom the Latin, was made, in spite of the opposition of the Vatican and Pope &nbsp;who, when no longer able to suppress its\npublication.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his death, Emperor\nDomitian's memory was condemned to oblivion by the pagan Roman Senate, while\nsenatorial authors such as Tacitus, Pliny the Younger and Suetonius published\nhistories propagating the view of Domitian as a cruel and paranoid tyrant.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was\nconvinced that Nerva was plotting behind his back with Apollonius .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius was one of the\ngreatest travellers known to antiquity. Among the countries and places he\nvisited the following are the chief ones recorded by Philostratus describes the\nship travels of Apollonius and Damisa to Muziris in Kerala and their time spent\nin Muzris University ( Kodungallur/ Cranganore ) where Pythagoras and Plato had\nstudied.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He mentions of his second visit to India and his visit to Taxila\nUniversity &nbsp;( Attoack )(ii 20); and so\nthey make their way across the tributaries of the Indus (ii 43) to the valley\nof the Ganges (iii 5), and finally arrive at the \u201cmonastery of the wise men\u201d\n(iii 10), where Apollonius spends four months (iii 50).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not so bright Damisa\nwrote Bharat as Paracha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thence Apollonius\ncrosses over to Lesbos (iv 13), and subsequently sails for Athens, where he\nspends some years in Greece (iv 17-33) visiting the temples of Hellas,\nreforming their rites and instructing the priests (iv 24).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We next find him in\nCrete (iv 34), and subsequently at Rome in the time of Nero (iv 36-46). In A.D.\n66 Nero issued a decree forbidding any philosopher to remain in Rome, and\nApollonius set out for Spain, and landed at Gades, and travelled to the Pagan library\nof Cordoba.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; In A.D. 66 Nero issued a decree forbidding\nany philosopher to remain in Rome, and Apollonius set out for Spain, and landed\nat Gades, and travelled to Cordoba. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From Pireaus ,\nApollonius sails for Chios (v 21), thence to Rhodes, and so to Alexandria (v\n24). At Alexandria he spends some time, and has several interviews with the\nfuture Emperor Vespasian (v 27-41), <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now Vespasian was\nemperor from 69 to 79, and Titus from 79 to 81. As Apollonius\u2019 interviews with\nVespasian took place shortly before the beginning of that emperor\u2019s reign, . In\n81 Domitian became emperor, and just as Apollonius opposed the follies of Nero,\nso did he criticise the acts of Domitian.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He accordingly became an object of\nsuspicion to the emperor; but instead of keeping away from Rome, he determined\nto brave the tyrant to his face.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius had written down the exact date,\ntime and minute of the death of Domitian by astrology and Domitian felt that\nthis was plain pre-arranged murder managed by Nerva and Apollonius.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Damisa had written about the indomitable\nenergy of the vegetarian Apollonius , his power of endurance, his handsome and\nstately demeanour and perfect physique even in old age\u2014how he did Surya\nNamaskar at dawn , travelled barefooted , was celebate , wore only white cotton --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Damisa and\nApollonius had studied hands on ( Reiki ) healing in India . Damisa wrote about\nthe Apollonius\u2019s &nbsp;ability to reverse cell\nage of patients.&nbsp; He called it psychic\ndiagnosis and prescience.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Damis\u2019\nnarrative goes into great lengths of the psychic and spiritual knowledge of the\nIndian sages in the Himalayas &nbsp;with &nbsp;caste-mark on the forehead (iii 7, II)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\u201c They know what takes place at a distance,\nthey can tell the past and future, and read the past births of men\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c the Brahma-vidy\u00e2 from\ntheir lips, but he has also learnt how to converse with them though his body be\nin Greece and their bodies in India\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He writes about \u201cSoma\nin the cup of Tantalus - and about &nbsp;amrit,\nthe ocean of immortality and wisdom, of the Indians\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philostratus writes\nabout the visit of Apollonius to the <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">temple of Serapis in Alexandria. </span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soon as he reached there he was surrounded\nby the priests and devotees and Apollonius started giving instruction on the correct way to conduct rituals .</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tig4T63ZiDg/Vwc5gc9sMwI/AAAAAAABHH8/5KGUh1CnkRwpY9iC5GZYtU81C95zfY1Xg/s1600/httpkivalibutkeducollection-imagesegygptegypt063_7287606f6a.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"456\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-tig4T63ZiDg/Vwc5gc9sMwI/AAAAAAABHH8/5KGUh1CnkRwpY9iC5GZYtU81C95zfY1Xg/s640/httpkivalibutkeducollection-imagesegygptegypt063_7287606f6a.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c He commanded\nuniversal respect, everything about him and every word he uttered seemed to\nbreathe an atmosphere of wisdom and of \"something divine.\"&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OXyhmZuNB9c/Vwc797SbYTI/AAAAAAABHIU/tIpTVtnEsZI9dKrlwNDiofps2uDBFBDdA/s1600/temple_of_serapis__ancient_alexandria__sgecond_life_by_aeternussapiens-d6i17wy.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"330\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OXyhmZuNB9c/Vwc797SbYTI/AAAAAAABHIU/tIpTVtnEsZI9dKrlwNDiofps2uDBFBDdA/s640/temple_of_serapis__ancient_alexandria__sgecond_life_by_aeternussapiens-d6i17wy.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9sRp1-fMJOM/Vwc54IOn2QI/AAAAAAABHIE/_7q8ebG43jglMfxtY-8KCWQjRr-SmVFhw/s1600/n_71586f_1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9sRp1-fMJOM/Vwc54IOn2QI/AAAAAAABHIE/_7q8ebG43jglMfxtY-8KCWQjRr-SmVFhw/s640/n_71586f_1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The high\npriest of the temple looked on in proud&nbsp; disdain.\n\"<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Who is wise enough,</span>\" he mockingly asked, \"<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">to reform the\nreligion of the Egyptians</span>?\"\u2014</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--only to be met with the confident retort of\nApollonius: \"<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Any sage who comes from the India</span>.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Apollonius\nvisited India a second time with Damisa, he was given a list of Hindu temples\nto visit in Egypt.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He spent a long time\nthere inspecting the vaastu of pyramids and every single ancient monument\nrelated to Imhotep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He knew every entrance\nand crypt as if he had been there before.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/03/theory-of-everything-consciousness-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/03/theory-of-everything-consciousness-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PhzFmu-zTTo/VwdBQI5mloI/AAAAAAABHIk/TiYkjkKe16UoSftF40XZGF45vO1cgSHuw/s1600/5d161ac7fa16ceV20076321d2a526e3bd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"556\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PhzFmu-zTTo/VwdBQI5mloI/AAAAAAABHIk/TiYkjkKe16UoSftF40XZGF45vO1cgSHuw/s640/5d161ac7fa16ceV20076321d2a526e3bd.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When he visited the\nstatue of Thoth , he suddenly opened up a crypt vault seal, which nobody had\nnoticed before.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DcQbaeDydlY/VwdBY-qKAKI/AAAAAAABHIo/0FieXey_tEUEqwFV9ZmZCc0mNNjPkkthQ/s1600/a551944d859f367cbbad26dEb1658d0a6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DcQbaeDydlY/VwdBY-qKAKI/AAAAAAABHIo/0FieXey_tEUEqwFV9ZmZCc0mNNjPkkthQ/s640/a551944d859f367cbbad26dEb1658d0a6.jpg\" width=\"486\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He swiftly went under the statue\nand there existed a greater statue in a huge chamber \u2014the REAL one holding the priceless EMERALD TABLET\nOF IMHOTEP .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IrgIhGx8c9U/VwdBf6utDxI/AAAAAAABHIs/lSrrkWA1Pu8EVRcXP94F0Tn60tYCVezWA/s1600/hqdefaulTt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-IrgIhGx8c9U/VwdBf6utDxI/AAAAAAABHIs/lSrrkWA1Pu8EVRcXP94F0Tn60tYCVezWA/s640/hqdefaulTt.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This tablet is now with the Freemasons who had given info to Isaac Newton to figure it out.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Greeks and the\nEgyptians had written about this lost emerald green tablet &nbsp;with the 3D Sri Yantra inherent in it along\nwith secret knowledge from GARUDA PURANA . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nL2ICy2TvKo/VwdBtXwT6UI/AAAAAAABHIw/fTfV0A1bkZEes3R78gDfaWwuNdUc3TKjA/s1600/thothbElue2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nL2ICy2TvKo/VwdBtXwT6UI/AAAAAAABHIw/fTfV0A1bkZEes3R78gDfaWwuNdUc3TKjA/s400/thothbElue2.jpg\" width=\"265\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Emerald Tablet,\nalso known as the Smaragdine Table, or Tabula Smaragdina, is a compact and\ncryptic piece of Hermetica reputed to contain the secret of the prima materia\nand its transmutation. The layers of meaning in the Emerald Tablet have been\nassociated with the creation of the philosopher's stone, laboratory\nexperimentation, phase transition, the alchemical magnum opus, the ancient,\nclassical, element system, and the correspondence between macrocosm and\nmicrocosm. The Emerald Tablet is said to be a tablet of emerald or green stone\ninscribed with the secrets of the universe. - text describes seven stages of\nalchemical transformation \u2013 calcination, dissolution, separation, conjunction,\nfermentation, distillation and coagulatio</span></i>n\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imhotep ( Lord Ayyappa\n) the 9<sup>th</sup> avatar of Vishnu is represented as Vishnu carrier GARUDA &nbsp;-- the divine builder of the Great Pyramid of\nGiza - Thoth as eagle Garuda<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q5e7e5rYvvA/VwdCLfAnGAI/AAAAAAABHI4/HkDmUSRGtfQqac6SttOCm8xyq0i5CnAnQ/s1600/18400942-Statue-of-Ra-Sun-Govd-Stock-Photo-ra-egypt-horus.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-q5e7e5rYvvA/VwdCLfAnGAI/AAAAAAABHI4/HkDmUSRGtfQqac6SttOCm8xyq0i5CnAnQ/s640/18400942-Statue-of-Ra-Sun-Govd-Stock-Photo-ra-egypt-horus.jpg\" width=\"484\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thoth resembles Garuda\nin some respects:&nbsp;&nbsp; Thoth was the god\nassociated with writing, knowledge , Pharoah\u2019s funeral rites for passage to the\ndivine world.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thoth is said to preside\nover scribes and scholars.&nbsp; &nbsp;In India Garuda is the vehicle of Lord Vishnu and\nis also the &nbsp;lord of knowledge&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-mA6EZMX1zms/VwdCcfoYDRI/AAAAAAABHJA/K6J-43I1Ck4rmU_vYcgfNqnVJH_z3Dvvg/s1600/imFages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-mA6EZMX1zms/VwdCcfoYDRI/AAAAAAABHJA/K6J-43I1Ck4rmU_vYcgfNqnVJH_z3Dvvg/s400/imFages.jpg\" width=\"258\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Garuda\nPurana is a conversation between Lord Vishnu and Garuda and it deals with\nfuneral rites and the metaphysics of reincarnation, which set ablaze the\nimagination of every Pharoah.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jcLP27Ma4DY/VwdCh4kssqI/AAAAAAABHJE/Ymw3zZI26x8-JMxsxC0Mw7sL0S8HYbkxA/s1600/imFag7INes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jcLP27Ma4DY/VwdCh4kssqI/AAAAAAABHJE/Ymw3zZI26x8-JMxsxC0Mw7sL0S8HYbkxA/s400/imFag7INes.jpg\" width=\"246\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Garuda Purana lies in\nthe fact that it is the only sacred text that talks about the life after death,\nthe journey of the soul, death and its aftermath, rebirth or\nreincarnation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uKieoqar0zM/VwdFeQvtb1I/AAAAAAABHJk/BMePlcpyX4MqommOn3aPZSCtXLxOBXgIA/s1600/Narayana%2BVishnu%2BGbcaruda.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uKieoqar0zM/VwdFeQvtb1I/AAAAAAABHJk/BMePlcpyX4MqommOn3aPZSCtXLxOBXgIA/s640/Narayana%2BVishnu%2BGbcaruda.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the modern science\ncould not break the mystery of death and after; whereas, Garuda Purana has\nspelled out these realities ages before.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/garuda-vimana-of-vishnu-and-garuda.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/garuda-vimana-of-vishnu-and-garuda.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India for Shraddh\nthe priest recites Sanskrit verses from Garuda Purana.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TSsIPZgNNS8/VwdDTFc-uHI/AAAAAAABHJM/seH55lKkJEg0wHXncx3UhO3bXccWI0f5w/s1600/lionheadL_jp40.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-TSsIPZgNNS8/VwdDTFc-uHI/AAAAAAABHJM/seH55lKkJEg0wHXncx3UhO3bXccWI0f5w/s640/lionheadL_jp40.jpg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vivekananda inspected\nthe pyramids and sphinx. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have inspected most\nmonuments in Egypt in greater detail \u2014 and I have greater perception than\nVivekananda<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014am I&nbsp; boasting ? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So be it !<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
