line-height: 200%;\"></span><br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/secrets-of-egyptian-pyramids-revealed.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/secrets-of-egyptian-pyramids-revealed.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the FIRST COUNCIL AT\nNICEA , major time was spend in how to name the cooked up messiah. After hours\nof deliberation it was decided to include ISHA ( of the Ishani OR Essene sect\nof Apollonius ) and Krisht ( Lord Krishna ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have a ISHA Upanishad\n. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Isha Upanishad is significant\nfor its singular mention of the term &nbsp;ISHA in the first hymn<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0908\u0936\u093e\u0935\u093e\u0938\u094d\u092f\u092e\u093f\u0926\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0930\u094d\u0935\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u0924\u094d\u0915\u093f\u091e\u094d\u091a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u0917\u0924\u094d\u092f\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091c\u0917\u0924\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0947\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0915\u094d\u0924\u0947\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0941\u091e\u094d\u091c\u0940\u0925\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u0943\u0927\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u0938\u094d\u092f\u0938\u094d\u0935\u093f\u0926\u094d\u0927\u0928\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\">\u012b\u015b\u0101v\u0101syamida\u1e43 sarva\u1e43\nyatki\u00f1ca jagaty\u0101\u1e43 jagat | <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">tena tyaktena bhu\u00f1j\u012bth\u0101\nm\u0101 g\u1e5bdha\u1e25 kasyasviddhanam ||</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\">Enveloped by the Lord\nmust be This All \u2014 each thing that moves on earth. With that renounced, enjoy\nthyself. Covet no wealth of any man. \u2014\u2009</span><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: purple;\">Isha\nUpanishad, Hymn 1 5000 BC</span><o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>CHANGE is the only\nconstant in the cosmos. Whatever can be changed in this ephemeral universe all that must be enveloped by the Brahman. &nbsp;Understand this - by this renunciation,\nsupport yourself. Do not covet the wealth of anyone.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Brahman is the real\nnature of this world. Realize that do not lose sight of that, caught up in the\ntrivial waves of passing sense experience, says the verse.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Change is here death\nis here, in every phase of life; there is no steady base here on which we can safely\nerect the structure of our life; but look deeper, says the Upanishad, and you\nwill see the death-less in the midst of death, the changeless in the midst of\nmany.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>This is the great message of the Upanishads, the message of the immortal\nand imperishable Self behind the mortal and the perishable. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>We are all on a raft\nflowing down the rapids without a paddle. One thing is 100% sure--one day ,\nyour raft will plunge down the waterfall , and you will die. &nbsp;NO amount of money can prevent this. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Don't be in awe of\ndeath and demean life on the&nbsp; raft. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>While you are on the\nraft of life, be graceful,be happy. &nbsp;&nbsp;Fish\n, but don't over-fish. &nbsp;What is the\npoint? &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your great grand\nchildren will NOT even visit your grave , to piss on it-- leave alone being\ngrateful.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Live and let live. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;</i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cant take your\nmoney to the grave ( even the Pharaoh could NOT do that ).&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In any case , your\nmoney is just a figure on the computer. You can't see it,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">nor can you count it. You cannot eat more\nthan thrice a day.</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">You came naked , you\nwill go naked. After the game of life , the KING and the PAWN goes into the\nsame box.</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>You will be remembered\nonly by your contributions to mankind and this planet. Rest goes to the garbage\nbin of history. In this Internet information super highway age, you cant even manipulate\nthe media and shine for a grand obituary..<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</i></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Remember, there is\ngreat joy in being ordinary. The most valuable things in life are free.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/gmoS-1v7VyQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/gmoS-1v7VyQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u094b\u093d\u0938\u093e\u0935\u0938\u094c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0941\u0930\u0941\u0937\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094b\u093d\u0939\u092e\u0938\u094d\u092e\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">yo's\u0101vasau puru\u1e63a\u1e25\nso'hamasmi<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">I am He, the Purusha\nwithin thee. ( Isha Upanishad )</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nspiritual oneness of the whole universe, cosmic, celestial, as well as\nterrestrial, this knowledge is emphasized again and again in the Upanishads.\nThe difference in size or in quality or even function does not involve\ndifference in the basic reality\u2014as we are holographic .. &nbsp;The universe with all its differences, is on\nthe surface, but unity at the depths. &nbsp;The\nAtman is the reality behind all beings, big and small. A big wave and a small\nbubble of water have their basic oneness in the ocean.&nbsp; Vedanta hastens to ask us to see the One\nbehind the many. &nbsp;The devotee is not\nfrightened simply because the sun is big in size and he is small. His knowledge\ntells him, his penetrating vision assures him, that behind the big and the\nsmall there is a common unity of spiritual nature</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.\n&nbsp;<b>Adi\nShankaracharya inVivekachudamani (verse 244): 2000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hkq1O00Bivw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hkq1O00Bivw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; Thou knowest all our deeds. Lord, destroy the deceitful sin in us. We\nsalute Thee with our words again and again.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/X6MfsmUmmKc/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/X6MfsmUmmKc?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u2018One result they say is obtained by vidya, and\nanother result, they say, is obtained by avidya, thus have we heard from the\nwise ones who explained it to us.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u2018He who knows both vidya and avidya together,\novercomes death through avidya and experiences immortality by means of vidya.\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nNOWADAYS WHEN I WANT TO LAUGH MY GUTS OUT, I TUNE ON TO SINGLE BOOK, SINGLE MESSIAH RELIGION EVANGELIST CHANNELS -- FULL OF MINDLESS RHETORIC AND ZILCH SUBSTANCE .<br />\n<br />\nIF VEDANTA IS THE BRILLIANT SUN, THESE ARE COLD FIRE FLIES.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No religious text or discourse on this planet has ever\nprojected the 7000 YEAR OLD wisdom of Vedanta , of pruning out unwanted knowledge\nby UNLEARNING.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Mecca the cubic\nstructure is called KAABA , It was originally a Shiva temples ( Kaabalishwara )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Mahesh is another name\nfor Shiva.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">This is a conjoined MAHA +\nISHA&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Maha means GREAT.</span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 200%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/944Fik5Y66Y/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/944Fik5Y66Y?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The sect of Apollonius was called Ishanis. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">This was hijacked at the First Council of Nicea in 325 to be renamed as ESSENE &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 18.6667px; line-height: 37.3333px;\">Christianity</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dif8418sn1s/VwerN6vDYpI/AAAAAAABHNY/3bbVrtHV4qAskEUFGa69IpZlsgTlR6zhg/s1600/isha-the-islamic-prayer-to-hindu-gMMod-shiva-1-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dif8418sn1s/VwerN6vDYpI/AAAAAAABHNY/3bbVrtHV4qAskEUFGa69IpZlsgTlR6zhg/s640/isha-the-islamic-prayer-to-hindu-gMMod-shiva-1-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 345 A.D., when the\nruler of Carnellur ( Kodungallur ) gave the suburb of Muziris to the Ishanis\nfor their exclusive use, they renamed it Mahadevar Pattanam, the City of Maheshwara\n(Shiva). &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The king laid the first\nbrick for the Ishani temple that was built there, and upon its completion he\nled the first service of prayers to be conducted there.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This would not have\nbeen done if the Ishanis were not themselves Hindus. &nbsp;Eventually an Ishani conclave &nbsp;with Mahadevar Pattanam as its centre, was\nestablished.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html?showComment=1460103241472#c8535585660204764094\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">April 8, 2016 at 1:44 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_32MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi c,<br />\n<br />\nhindus never cremated sages who have attained MOKSHA ( jivan mukts ) .<br />\n<br />\nWE BURY SAGES AND SMALL CHILDREN , LESS THAN 28 WEEKS , WHO HAVE NOT FORMED AN EGO .<br />\n<br />\npharoahs considered themselves supreme mortals.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/moksha-final-stop-to-endless-cycle-of.html<br />\n<br />\nAbout seven weeks after conception the first neurons and synapses begin to develop in the spinal cord. These early neural connections allow the fetus to make its first movements, which can be detected by ultrasound and MRI even though in most cases the mother cannot feel them.<br />\nNewborns can recognize human faces, which they prefer over other objects, and can even discriminate between happy and sad expressions. The brain continues to develop at an amazing rate throughout the first year. The cerebellum triples in size, which appears to be related to the rapid development of motor skills that occurs during this period.<br />\n<br />\nA child\u2019s vocabulary will quadruple between his first and second birthday.<br />\n<br />\nDuring the second year, there is a major increase in the rate of myelination, which helps the brain perform more complex tasks. Higher-order cognitive abilities like self-awareness are developing: an infant is now more aware of his own emotions and intentions. When he sees his reflection in a mirror, he now fully recognizes that it is his own. S<b><span style=\"color: red;\">oon he will begin using his own name as well as personal pronouns like \u201cI\u201d and \u201cme.\u201d ( the start of EGO \u2013I ) .&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">By age 3 ( 36 months ) the child has an EGO and understands cause and effect.</span><br />\n<br />\nHuman love is limited because ego and selfishness is contained in it. The ego thrives on others and lives on attention . Human ego demands personal recognition and wastes energy in resentment if it does not get enough. The underlying emotion for the ego is fear, the fear of being a nobody. There is always a sense of insecurity around the ego even if on the outside it appears confident , perfumed and powdered.<br />\n<br />\nEgo strengthens itself by diminishing others. Ego is insanity of the human mind. Unhappiness is an ego created mental cum emotional disease. The chatter of the ego continuously disrupts the natural state of well being. Stress is from within the mind , not by external threat. Ego creates suffering without recognising it. Many people carry large amount of unnecessary baggage, both mental and emotional through out their lives. They hang on to the old emotion to strengthen their identity.<br />\n<br />\nJIVAN MUKHTS HAVE NO EGO.<br />\n<br />\nPEOPLE WHO ATTAIN MOKSHA ARE BURIED IN A MEDITATIVE POSITION.<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE A MOKSHA JATAKAM ( HOROSCOPE ).<br />\n<br />\nI PLAN TO BE CREMATED , AS I HAVE EGO. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hellenistic philosopher Philo Judaeus of Alexandria (20 BCE-50 AD/CE)\u2014alive at the&nbsp;&nbsp; purported time of Jesus, and one of the\nwealthiest and best connected citizens of the Empire\u2014&nbsp; makes no mention of Christ, Christians or\nChristianity in his voluminous writings. &nbsp; Nor do any of the hundreds of other\nhistorians and writers who flourished during the first THREE centuries of the\ncommon era<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every month the\nChristian lobby of Kerala &nbsp;and the\nChristian CM led govt of Kerala &nbsp;gives\nfake news that he Aranmula project wil start soon. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Supreme Court of India ratified the order of\nNational Green Tribunal Verdict declaring Aranmula Airport Project as violating\nall environmental requirements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/no-sanction-given-for-aranmula-airport-project/article7249526.ece\">http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/tamil-nadu/no-sanction-given-for-aranmula-airport-project/article7249526.ece</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Philostratus\u2019s\nthird-century chronicle Vita Apollonii, there is no hint of Jesus.&nbsp; &nbsp;Nor\ndoes Jesus appear in the works of other Apollonius epistolarians and\nscriveners: Emperor Titus, Cassius Dio, Maximus, Moeragenes, Lucian, Soterichus\nOasites, Euphrates, Marcus Aurelius, or Damis of Hierapolis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is abundantly clear\nthat that none of the writers till 325 AD &nbsp;ever heard of Jesus, his miracles and alleged\nworldwide fame be damned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Another bewildering author is Philo of\nAlexandria. &nbsp;He spent his first-century\nlife in the Levant and even traversed Jesus-land. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philo chronicled contemporaries of\nJesus\u2014Bassus, Pilate, Tiberius, Sejanus, Caligula\u2014yet knew nothing of the\nstoried prophet and rabble-rouser enveloped in glory and astral marvels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historian Flavius\nJosephus published his Jewish Wars in 95 AD. He had lived in Japhia, one mile\nfrom Nazareth\u2014yet Josephus seems unaware of both Nazareth and Jesus. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jesus\u2019s infant\ncircumcision (Luke 2:21) was thus a lie, as well as the crucifixion! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The so called&nbsp; second-century Christian father Athenagoras\nand never encountered the word Jesus\u2014Athenagoras was unacquainted with the name\nof his savior!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emperor Marcus\nAurelius admitted that it was to Apollonius that he owed his own philosophy,\nand erected temples and statues in his honor.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No statues , temples or churches\nwere ever erected to Jesus Christ till 325 AD.. Nobody ever saw a man on the\ncross in any religious institution. Nobody head of the Bible till 325 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faust wrote&nbsp;<i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cEveryone\nknows that the Gospels were written neither by Jesus nor by his apostles, but\nlong after their time by some unknown persons, who, judging well that they\nwould hardly be believed when telling of things they had not seen themselves,\nheaded their narratives with the names of the apostles or disciples\ncontemporaneous with the latter.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cConversely, the\nwritten record of the life of Apollonius is very sound, and Philostratos, who\nwrote the Life of Apollonius, was the close friend of Damus, who had related\nthe whole thing in person\u201d.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote Wikipedia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; I<i>n the important Nambudiri Brahmin 17th\nCentury tract, the Keralolpathi. However, in this Brahmin version of the\nlegend, the \"Thoman\" referred to is Thomas of Cana.[14] Saint Thomas\nChristians did not use any iconography or statues of Jesus or the saints in\ntheir churches until after the arrival of the Portuguese.&nbsp; &nbsp;Saint\nThomas Christians did not use any iconography or statues of Jesus or the saints\nin their churches until after the arrival of the Portuguese. The rituals\nrelated to birth, Vidyarambham, marriage, pregnancy, death etc. were also\nsimilar in both communities. Now also, tying Thaali, a Hindu symbol of marriage\nis the most important rite in the Christian marriages too.</i>UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever a child\nreached the age of three years the Ishanis always had a Brahmin pandit come to\ntheir home and symbolically begin his formal education ( Vidhyarambham Samskara\n) by guiding the child\u2019s fingers to trace the mantra Om ( or Hari ) Sri\nGanapataye Namah\u00ac\u2013\u201cI bow to Lord Ganesha\u201d \u2013in a plate of rice before which a\nghee lamp was burning that had previously been worshipped as an emblem of the\ngoddess Saraswati. This is still the custom among the Saint Thomas Christians\nin the St Thomas temple of Kodungallur . . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/kerala/vidyarambham-for-many-children-in-wayanad-district/article26139.ece\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/kerala/vidyarambham-for-many-children-in-wayanad-district/article26139.ece</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vidyarambham on\nVijayadashami festival also takes place at the Cheraman Perumal mosque at\nKodungallur<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://www.thehindu.com/2003/10/06/stories/2003100606950400.htm\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.thehindu.com/2003/10/06/stories/2003100606950400.htm</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/03/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_21.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/03/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_21.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The DEAD SEA SCROLLS &nbsp;were all written by Pagan Essenes . None of\nthem have been edited by later Christians, as is the case with some other\nJewish literature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the scrolls (except\na treasure map known as the Copper Scroll) can be dated prior to A.D. 68 or 69,\nwhen the Qumran settlement was believed to have been destroyed by the Romans in\nthe Jewish revolt. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oldest of the\nscrolls probably goes back to the middle of the third century B.C. &nbsp;&nbsp;The &nbsp;people of Qumran belonged to a Pagan religious\ngroup known as the Essenes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pliny the Elder, who\ndied during the volcanic destruction of Pompeii in the year 79 A.D., described\na community of pagan Essenes living on the western shore of the Dead Sea, close\nto where Khirbet Qumran is situated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John the Baptist was an\nascetic Essene . He was a vegan and was uncircumcised .&nbsp; Various literary sources like Josephus and\nPhilo tell clearly that Essenes were ascetics.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We also know, from literary\ntestimony, the Dead Sea Scrolls, and the archaeological remains of Qumran, that\nthe Essenes practiced many water baptisms for ritual purification\u2014similar to a\ndip in the Ganges or the river Pampa or at Thiirunelli. At Qumran, however, all\nmembers of the community were baptized with water for ritual purification<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-X6pp6BoWnnA/VweqlxGssdI/AAAAAAABHNM/f8c5O9Bhq90tw6NgPeXfcgo8Ac7IYb47A/s1600/imagees.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-X6pp6BoWnnA/VweqlxGssdI/AAAAAAABHNM/f8c5O9Bhq90tw6NgPeXfcgo8Ac7IYb47A/s400/imagees.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Essenes were famous\nfor their religious devotion. Philo believed the word \"Essene\" meant\n\"holy.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kbQvVRgfrFc/Vweq1jXReiI/AAAAAAABHNU/lxtYXTrPW5MJzCDkvsGMAuQ8R_QP-U-WA/s1600/downlorad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kbQvVRgfrFc/Vweq1jXReiI/AAAAAAABHNU/lxtYXTrPW5MJzCDkvsGMAuQ8R_QP-U-WA/s320/downlorad.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Josephus writes,\n\"And as for their piety towards God, it is very extraordinary; for before\nsunrising they speak not a word about profane matters, but put up certain\nprayers which they have received from their forefathers, as if they made a\nsupplication for its rising\" (Wars, 2.8.5). This testimony accords well\nwith what we know from the Dead Sea Scrolls.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xVRYDIYdlUA/VweqtMAepqI/AAAAAAABHNQ/UQmUM8YeKngIiRbwPYP782ZJMHLS2UZNg/s1600/qumran-cavde4-t.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"524\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xVRYDIYdlUA/VweqtMAepqI/AAAAAAABHNQ/UQmUM8YeKngIiRbwPYP782ZJMHLS2UZNg/s640/qumran-cavde4-t.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prayer and humility was\none thing that the Essenes . When they cooked up stories about Jesus they wrote\nthat Jesus Christ&nbsp; ate the Last Supper in\nthe Essene part of town<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8aVYGMCcgYY/Vwes02HeCBI/AAAAAAABHNo/pfmHctPyA9wzLGmZIHO2HXQP3EPDJ_0fA/s1600/qumrdan01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8aVYGMCcgYY/Vwes02HeCBI/AAAAAAABHNo/pfmHctPyA9wzLGmZIHO2HXQP3EPDJ_0fA/s400/qumrdan01.jpg\" width=\"352\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Essenes who were very\npure in their habits. They were frugal and were strict vegetarians, eating no\nmeat of any kind and drinking fresh fruit juices or water. They believed in\nworking in harmony with nature and the forces that surround the world and all\nwithin it. They knew Ayurveda and they got their herbs from Muziris\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"For many , the name\nEssene was equivalent to a healer and a physician who uses herbs and touch\".</span></i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OLj009Dl_o0/VwewdhABjwI/AAAAAAABHOU/SAgcI_UeeX4gdchRxiqaadwfMSajArjCw/s1600/QumranGdn.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"376\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OLj009Dl_o0/VwewdhABjwI/AAAAAAABHOU/SAgcI_UeeX4gdchRxiqaadwfMSajArjCw/s640/QumranGdn.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cThey would practice\nthe healing of the sick in mind, body, and soul. They had two main communities,\none in Egypt, the other in Palestine near the Dead Sea. Another was in Syria.\nTheir origins can be traced to the Far East, and their methods of prayer,\nmeditation, and fasting were quite similar to Indian Vedic practices.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cEssene membership was\nopen to all and they were a well respected order with many hundreds waiting to\njoin. But their teachings were given only to members. To be a member of the\nEssene order, one had to pass a probationary period of one year and be able to\nfast for 40 days.&nbsp; The Essenes were a\npeaceful order of pious men and women who lived in asceticism, spending their\ndays in simple labor and their evenings in prayer. &nbsp; They never became involved\nwith political or military affairs. They never became merchants or entered into\ncommercial life in the cities, but maintained themselves by agriculture and\nraising sheep for wool, as well as by crafts like pottery and carpentry. Any\nprofits or harvests were not kept individually, but were given to the community\nand then divided\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cEvery member of the\nEssenes in Egypt or Palestine had to be a pure-blooded descendant of an Hindu\nBrahmin of the Aryan race.&nbsp; Immediately\nupon initiation, each member adopted a robe of white composed of one piece of\nmaterial ( white mundu ) , and he wore sandals.\u201d&nbsp;</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0GfL3d63l2o/Vwet1uq8jPI/AAAAAAABHN0/0SI58Ms34nI4lftGppqXUvT4HQWoOD06g/s1600/Mizzi-poster-small8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0GfL3d63l2o/Vwet1uq8jPI/AAAAAAABHN0/0SI58Ms34nI4lftGppqXUvT4HQWoOD06g/s640/Mizzi-poster-small8.jpg\" width=\"494\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the dead sea\nscrolls the pagan Essene sect , hundreds of years before Jesus Christ ,&nbsp; &nbsp;had a\nterminology and practice that has always been considered Hindu. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-B-H-55CzGGI/VweuL-BSGpI/AAAAAAABHN8/tWbk41P2ZsYRyCl4gy2CFt0HAqcpImwvQ/s1600/519OHxYOCuL._SY34gh4_BO1%252C204%252C203%252C200_.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-B-H-55CzGGI/VweuL-BSGpI/AAAAAAABHN8/tWbk41P2ZsYRyCl4gy2CFt0HAqcpImwvQ/s400/519OHxYOCuL._SY34gh4_BO1%252C204%252C203%252C200_.jpg\" width=\"255\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They believed in Karma\nand &nbsp;immortality of the soul. &nbsp;There was NO heaven and hell concept.&nbsp; Their most important teacher was a mysterious\nfigure called the Teacher of Righteousness.\u201d named ISHA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: 14pt; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For arguments sake \u2013even\nif messiah Jesus Christ existed , the gospels were written a even a century\nafter Jesus' estimated year of death, by individuals who &nbsp;never met Jesus, and then were edited or\nforged over the centuries by unknown scribes with their own agendas. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are no historic records about Jesus of\nNazareth from any non-Jewish author until the 325 AD ,and Jesus left no\nwritings or other archaeological evidence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Englishman Godfrey\nHiggins studied Greek, Latin and law at Cambridge . His two-volume, 867-page\nbook Anacalypsis: An Enquiry into the Origins of Languages, Nations, and\nReligions, was published posthumously in 1836.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his treatise, Higgins writes \" the mythos of the Jews and the mythos of the Greeks are all at bottom\nthe same lifted from the ancient mythos of Hindus ; and ... are contrivances\nunder the appearance of histories to perpetuate doctrines,\" and that\nChristian editors \u201ceither from roguery or folly, corrupted them all.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abraham Dirk Loman from\nthe University of Amsetrdam wrote in 1881 that all New Testament writings\nbelonged after 325 AD \u2013he said that &nbsp;Jesus Christ never existed . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1900, Scottish MP\nJohn Mackinnon Robertson wrote that Jesus never existed but was an FAKE invention\nby a first-century messianic cult. He wrote about the First Council of Nicea of\n325 AD where powerful forces invented a &nbsp;new god to fit the needs of the society of the\ntime .Robertson specifically mentions the Talmudic story of the Yeshu .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">J. M. Roberts in his\nbook \"Antiquity Unveiled,\" presented enough evidence was presented to\nprove that no such man as Jesus of Nazareth ever lived on planet earth, but the\nname was adopted by the cooks of of Christianity to cover the identity of\nApollonius of Tyana whose teachings and mode of life they purloined and made\nuse of as a model upon which to construct their system.\" He adds:\n\"The world has the uncontrovertible testimony that Christianity is of\nspurious origin and the most consummate piece of plagiarism in human\nhistory.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
