, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1607, fifty four\nscholars who were members of the Church of England took &nbsp;&nbsp;two\nyears and nine months to re-write the Bible and make it ready for press. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was, by the order of\nKing James, and on its completion in 1609, it was handed over to the King James\nfor his final approval. The Bible which all read and admire from a literary\npoint of view because of it's peculiar and beautiful English was written in\nthat form by Bacon who invented and perfected that style of English expression.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The first edition of the King James Bible, which was edited by Francis Bacon\nand prepared under Masonic supervision. The Jews were already in the business\nof claiming Jerusalem as their KOSHER Land. On 25 June 1607 Sir Francis Bacon\nwas appointed Solicitor-General and Chief Advisor to the Crown<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because King James\u2019\nBible was written to support the authority of a king ,the word \u2018authorised\u2019\nfound its way onto the title page and later still came to be printed on the\ncover, giving King James\u2019 new Bible a false sense of authenticity. The King\nJames Bible is considered by many today to be the 'original' Bible and\ntherefore 'genuine' and all later revisions simply counterfeits forged by\n'higher critics'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The philosophy of the\nEssenes was very exalted for that period of time. Traditionally, the Jewish\ndoctrine for justice was an eye for an eye. But the Essenes, even before\nChrist, taught that one should simply turn the other cheek. So in many cases\nwhen Jesus taught, he was simply repeating the doctrine of the Essenes which is\na lift from peaceful doctrine of Vedanta.. Apolloniuswould ofetnn talk about\nPythagoras and Plato who studied in Muziris ,India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the things\nPythagoras had declared was that meat-eating clouded the reasoning faculties,\nand that judges should refrain from eating meat before a trial to assure that\nthe most honest decisions would be made for those who went before them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras also taught the medicinal properties of plants and how to heal by\nthe use of color, vibrations, music, herbs, etc. He also taught how there was a\nSupreme World, spiritual in nature, which pervaded all things. The material\nworlds existed within the nature of this supreme sphere, and people should try\nto recognize the spiritual nature in their surroundings.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Essenes taught\nmany of these same points. They also believed in the eternality of the soul and\nthe philosophy of reincarnation, as did the Pythagoreans and other groups of\nthat time, and taught that rewards of good Karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only after the\nEcumenical councils at the time of Emperor Constantine, who was a meat-eater,\ndid vegetarian pagans have to practice underground. It was either this or live\nin fear of having molten lead poured down their throat, which Constantine would\ndo if he caught any vegetarians.&nbsp; Later\nthis molten lead thingy would be injected into Manu\u2019s account.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">St. Augustine (354-430\nA.D.) supported the anti Hindu view that animals have no soul and pushed meat-eating.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Constantine\nhowever worshipped pagan gods till he dies and was baptized as a corpse.&nbsp; He worshipped &nbsp;different demigods, who are the presiding\ndeities of different planets. &nbsp;Thus, Sunday\nis for the sun, Monday is for the moon, Tues is the Greek name for Mars,\nWednesday is for Mercury, Thursday for Jupiter, Friday for Venus, and Saturday\nfor Saturn.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The same existed in Kerala and India when the white man was running\naround naked doing GRUNT GRUNT for language.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">We in India has the 7000\nyear old Sanskrit/ Malayalam panchangams for the days and the astrology planets\nof the week. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole world has\ncopied from India and check out who has taken the credit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>STEAL FROM OTHERS AND\nPATENT IN OWN NAME \u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IS THE MOTTO OF THE IMMORAL WHITE MAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Names_of_the_days_of_the_week\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Names_of_the_days_of_the_week</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sunday/&nbsp; Sun (Aditya, Ravi)&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Monday/ Moon (Soma,\nIndu) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tuesday/ Mars (Mangala)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wednesday/ Mercury\n(Budha)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thursday/&nbsp; Jupiter (Guru )&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Friday/ Venus ( Shukra)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saturday/&nbsp; Saturn (Shani)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Essenes were\nteetotalers, vegans and ate to live rather than the other way around.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Christian plagiarists\nover the&nbsp; centuries were attempting to\namalgamate and fuse practically every myth, fairytale, legend, doctrine or bit\nof wisdom they could \"borrow\" from the innumerable different mystery\nreligions&nbsp; and philosophies that existed\nat the time. In doing so, they forged, interpolated, mutilated, plagiarised ,\nlifted , stole , changed, and rewrote these texts for centuries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the white man\nruled India, we thought they were superior in brains. &nbsp;&nbsp;Thank god for the IT and computer era.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_59M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/04/apollonius-or-jesus-christ-who-is-real.html?showComment=1460135031679#c5594908269008004080\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">April 8, 2016 at 10:33 PM</a></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_59MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2016/04/08/we-have-nothing-left-the-saga-of-yemen-s-rescued-jews.html<br />\n<br />\nJEWS HAVE NO LOYALTY TO THE MOTHERLAND<br />\n<br />\nTHEY DO NOT EVEN KNOW WHAT IS GOOD FOR THEM-- ALWAYS FOOLED AND USED LIKE TOILET PAPER , BY THEIR HARD CORE AND CRIMINAL DNA LEADERS . . .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/if-zionist-jews-created-isis-who.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the dead sea scrolls\nwhatever is written reflects Vedanta\u2014never mind the FOUL spin of Jews and\nChristians. Why can the Jews and the Christians tell the truth for a change?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pagan Philo Judaeus of\nAlexandria &nbsp;(20 BC-50 AD) a Plato\nphilosopher wrote not only of the Essenes, but also of their closely related pagan\norder in Egypt -- the Therapeutae.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Philo on the Essenes (\nhe never wrote one single word about Jesus Christ )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Our Lawgiver\n(Moses) trained in community-living thousands of disciples called Essenes,\nprobably because of their holiness. They live in large societies located in\nmany Judean cities and villages.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Their\norganization is not based on family kinship, in which a man has no choice, but\non zeal for virtue and love of all men ...They enjoy the only genuine liberty,\nas is proved by their way of life. None of them is striving to get possession\nof any private property ... or anything to get rich by, for everything is put\ninto the common pool, which supplies the wants of all alike.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Dwelling together\nin one place, they therefore study together, eat together and associate with\none another, expending all their energies for the common good. There is\ndivision of labor, different men to different kinds of work, but whatever may\nbe their work, they do it with vigor, patience, and good cheer, never excusing\nthemselves from labor on account of cold, heat, or changes of weather. They are\nat work before sunrise and after the sun has set, considering their work to be\nthe best sort of gymnastic exercise, pleasanter and of more advantage than mere\nathletics.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"If any man falls\nsick, whatever medical treatment or resources are available are devoted to his\ncure, and his care and recovery are the concern of the whole community. Old\nmen, though they may be childless, are thus assured of happiness and tender\ncare in their old age, just as if they were the fathers of children both\nnumerous and affectionate. Even more, they are honored and cared for from the\nfree good will of the many, rather than from the bounden duty of\nblood-relatives....<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"So enviable,\nthen, is the Essene way of life, that not only private citizens but also mighty\nkings are filled with amazement and admiration at them, and have honored the\nfraternity by lavishing praise and honor upon these respected and venerated\nmen.\"</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jews have tried to\nclaim Philo \u2013but he was pagan and did NOT understand Hebrew.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NAZRANIS OF KERALA\nLISTEN UP- AND LISTEN UP GOOD .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Essenes belonged to\na larger, more ancient line of adepts called the Nazars, \"those set apart\nto consecrate their lives to God\".&nbsp;\nHistorians, in fact, have failed to find a town called Nazareth in the\ndays of Jesus. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term may have\ndescribed, not his home, but his affiliation with this group of initiates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NO MORE BULL ABOUT\nJESUS CHRIST OF NAZARETH\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HERE GOES THE LAST NAIL\u2014&nbsp; DHADDDDH !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As students of the\noccult sciences the Essenes could read the stars, predict the future and heal.\nIn this region of the world, they alone knew the secret of the duration of the\nastrological. . They had an exoteric teaching for the multitudes and a secret\nor esoteric one for the inner circle\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">John the Baptist and Apollonius\nreceived their early training with the Essenes ( Ishanis ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Apollonius wrote books on astrology. His\nmission began by going to Antioch where he taught certain disciples. Wherever\nhe went he attracted large crowds and held them spellbound by his words and\ndeeds. Kings, rulers, and common folk constantly sought him for advice and he\ngave freely.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius travelled the world and always stood his ground and was\nregarded by many as a god in the flesh. He compiled the epistles, and retired\nto the isle of Patmos where he wrote the book of Revelation. Little is known\nabout his death ( as he came back to India ), but it is thought he lived past the the age of 100, and\nshortly thereafter got Moksha -- ascended to the inner earth paradise.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Temples and statues\nwere built in his honor, and for the first three centuries AD he was regarded\nas a demi-god and saint.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The popularity of Apollonius' teachings became a\nthreat to the decaying Roman Empire, so in 325 AD, At the Council of Nicae,\nemperor Constantine and his bishops devised the New Christianity and New\nTestament which would turn attention away from Appolonius, to a NON EXISTENT Judean\ncarpenter by the name of Jesus.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All records of Apollonius and his Essene\nChristianity were destroyed and this meant burning the libraries, including the\nmost famous one at Alexandria. The mobs who enforced the new changes met stiff\nresistance from the people, and some fifty million were eventually killed or\nmartyred in the process - a humongous carnage which has been DELETED by\nhistory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Important changes in\nthe biblical texts occurred ever since then, such as the removal of the\ndoctrines of non-violence, reincarnation, astrology, and vegetarianism; to be\nreplaced by their opposites \u2013 mindless violence , a mortal soul, a hellfire for\ndiviners, and permission for meat-eating and wine drinking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After his return from\nhis first trip to India in 39 CE, Apollonius created his own subsect within the\nEssenes known as Nazarites known as the 'Order of the Nazarenes' which would\nlater be known as the 'Essene Brotherhood' in Southern Judea, near Gaza which\nearned him the title Apollonius the Nazarene.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ever since Constantine\nfirst established it as the state religion of Rome, it has been responsible for\nthe death of over fifty million innocent people, under the charge that they\nwere \"heretics,\" because they refused to accept the unreasonable\ndogmas of the church --including about three million women who were burnt alive\nas \"witches\" in comparatively recent times, by men who called\nthemselves priests of the Christian religion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original Nazarene,\nthe peaceful Essene Apollonius , whose goodness and pacifism extended not only\nto humanity but to the animal world and the environment as well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was a philosopher, a\nsocial leader, a moral teacher, a religious reformer and a healer. From one end\nof the Roman empire to the other, wherever he went, divine honors were bestowed\non him -- by all, from slave to emperor.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was undoubtedly the greatest man of\nhis age; and his date of birth (4 B.C.) and period of activity coincided\nexactly with those of the Christian messiah, except that APOLLONIUS'S life of\nincessant labor in behalf of humanity extended for over a century, during which\ntime he preserved his health of body and brilliance of mind unimpaired by the\npassage of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was a supreme\nexemplar of human perfection -- physically, mentally and spiritually. Oven\nseventeen temples were erected in honor of him in Rome and hundreds in the\nother parts of the Roman Empire. His name was APOLLONIUS OF TYANA.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No more\ncourageous humanitarian and social revolutionist has ever come to this world to\nhelp the human race and redeem it from suffering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alone and single-handed,\nhe defied the bloodiest tyrants who ever sat on the Roman throne -- Nero and\nhis more terrible successor, Domitian. Apollonius fearlessly travelled from one\nend of the Roman Empire to the other, speaking the truth against the ruling\ndespots<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And not content with\nsuch activities in the Roman provinces, he bravely entered Rome itself, after\nall philosophers had been expelled from the city under penalty of death by the Nero\nand then Domitian.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ACHAYAN CHRISTIANS OF\nKERALA LISTEN UP\u2014 AND LISTEN GOOD\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constantine directed\nhis armies to exterminate the descendants of Apollonius's Essenian followers,\nwho were known as Manichaeans.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finding that the religion of Rome was in a state\nof advanced decay and was daily losing hold on the masses, while the cult of\nApollonius and the communistic communities of his Manichaean followers, in\nspite of the severest persecution, kept spreading, threatening the vested\ninterests of Rome, Constantine's henchmen - the pagan priests of the Roman\nreligion - decided to hold a convention at Nicea in the year 325 A.D. for the\npurpose of establishing a new religion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They decided to take over the\npopularity enjoyed by the followers of Apollonius, appropriate its essential\ndoctrines (altering them so that they might be acceptable to Constantine), and\nto replace the philosopher Apollonius, a COOKED UP super-natural messiah whose\nteachings would be less radical and more acceptable to him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So in place of\nApollonius of Tyana, they put their newly created savior, whom they named\n\"Jesus Christ,\" who, THEN AND THERE, was first conceived and created\nin the minds of Roman priests who were later known as the Nicean Church\nFathers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As soon as Jesus was\nput in the place of Apollonius, the task of the Vatican was to destroy all records\nand evidence about Apollonius and his Essenian &nbsp;followers ( during the first three centuries\ntill 325 AD ), so that the world might forever be kept in darkness concerning\nthis foul deception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was for this reason\nthat the Alexandrian and other ancient libraries like Cordoba were burnt, so\nthat all books written during and pertaining to the &nbsp;FIRST THREE CENTURIES of our era &nbsp;can be deleted&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And so well did the Catholic\nchurchmen succeed in obliterating such records, that, for nearly two thousand\nyears, the world has been kept in darkness concerning the fact that Apollonius\nof Tyana was the recognized Messiah and that NO persona named Jesus Christ ever\nexisted .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOT ANY MORE !</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plutarch, the eminent\nbiographer, who lived between 45 and 120 A. D. would certainly have made\nmention of Jesus Christ if he had existed, since he wrote when Jesus's fame\nwould have been at its height. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet in\nthe voluminous works of Plutarch, not a single reference to any such man as\nJesus can be found\u2014&nbsp;&nbsp; not a single word .\nPlutarch did NOT write a single sentence about Christianity. Yet he wrote a\ngreat deal about Apollonius and the Essenes <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plutarch knew the\nutmost detail of the lives of great men who lived centuries ago, we could\nhardly believe that Plutarch could have been entirely unaware of the existence\nof such a great man as Jesus who lived only a few years previously.&nbsp; Plutarch even gave the count of the elephants\nwhich fought against the army of Alexander the Great<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plutarch spent the last\nthirty years of his life serving as priest in the pagan temple of Delphi.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plutarch\nwas a Platonist, and he has written that Plato had studied in India like\nPythagoras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_128M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">IF YOU TELL HIM, THAT HE WILL BE CREMATED ,\nTHE HINDU WILL GO WITH A SMILE ON HIS LIPS.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\" Apollonius was\nborn in the same mysterious manner in the same year when Jesus is supposed to\nhave been born (the year 4 B.C.) \"Apollonius of Tyana:\" \"A\nstrange distinctive figure, clad in white linen and not in garments wrought of\nskins; with feet unsandled and with locks unshorn; austere, reserved, and of meagre\nmien; with-eyes cast upon the ground as was his manner, Apollonius of Tyana\ndrew to him with something of a saint's attraction all simple folk, and yet won\nas intimates the Emperors of Rome.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Cities sent envoys and embassies to him\ndecreeing him public favors; monarchs bestowed special dignities upon him,\ncounting him worthy to be their counsellor; incense was burnt before his\naltars; and after his death divine honours were paid to his images, which had\nbeen erected, with great enthusiasm, in all the temples of the gods description\nof Apollonius\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"He had a\nZeus-like head, long beard and hair descending to his shoulders, bound with a\ndeep fillet. Damis describes Apollonius as ever mild, gentle and modest, and in\nthis manner, more like an Indian than a Greek, though, when witnessing some\nspecial,&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">enormity, he would\nburst out indignantly against it. His mood was often pensive, and when not\nspeaking he would remain for long with eyes cast down, plunged in deep thought.\nThough always stern with himself, he readily made excuses for others.\u201d</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cDuring Nero's reign,\nwhen, on his way to Rome, Apollonius was warned that he and his followers would\nbe in danger, of thirty-four companions who set out with him, only eight\nremained staunch enough to brave the threatened peril; while praising the\ncourage of those few who remained with him, he refused to blame as cowards the\nmany who had fled.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cHe abstained from\nanimal food, wine and women -- and lived upon fruits and herbs, dressed only in\nwhite linen garments of the plainest construction, went barefooted and with uncovered\nhead, and wore his hair and beard uncut. He was especially distinguished for\nhis beauty, his genial bearing, his uniform love and kindness, and his\nimperturbable equanimity of temper.\"</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\" After having completed his labors for\nhumanity which lasted a century, it is believed he went to India to rejoin his\nteachers in the Himalayas. When and where he died is unknown. He prayed to the\nSun three times a day, offering incense and clarified butter &nbsp;but never sacrificing victims .&nbsp; He believed in the immortality of the soul,\nin metempsychosis [reincarnation], and in a supreme diety - the Creator of the\nUniverse\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cApollonius using\nindiscriminately the words `gods' or `god,' and the Indian sage Iarchus, with\nhis evident approval, likens the Universe to a ship of which the Creator is the\nMaster and the subordinate `gods' are petty officers [cf. the Christian idea of\norders of `angels' who assist in the smooth running of creation, and the Hindu\nidea of a trinity of `gods' - Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva - representing the\ncreative, preserving and destructive energies that are operating continually\nwithin the creation, each having their correlative functions or energy centers\n(chakras) within the human body - which in itself is but a microcosm or\nreflection of the macrocosmic universe\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAfter his death the\nEmperor Hadrian built a temple and endowed a priesthood for his worship of\nTyana. The emperor Aurelian vowed to do the like, calling him the most godlike,\nholy and venerable of mankind, endowed with more than mortal powers, and\ndeclaring: \"If I live, I will publish at least a summary of his wonderful\ndeeds, not because they need anything my words can give, but to make them\nfamiliar to all lips, as they are marvellous.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Another emperor,\nAlexander Severus, with questionable taste, set the image of Apollonius in his\nprivate chapel or solarium, among his tutelary deities, in company with Indian\nsage Orpheus\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c Even in the Catacombs\nof the early Christians there was no representation of Jesus, while Orpheus is\nrepresented as the central object of Worship. It is probable that Indian sage\nOrpheus was considered as the founder of the religion of which Apollonius was\nthe apostle. Towards the end of the third century, just previous to the\nformation of the church, the struggle between the Pythagorean supporters of Apollonius\nand his opponents, who later organized the Roman Catholic Church at Nicea,\nreached its last and bitter stages . At this time there were temples and\nshrines all over Asia Minor dedicated to Apollonius and his work, but there\nwere none to Jesus, for he was unknown since he did not exist. While Jesus\nspent his life in Galilee among the common people, Apollonius travelled from\none end of the world to the other, studying the wisdom of the greatest minds\nthat could be found -- the Brahmans of the Himalayas, the Gymnosophist\nphilosophers of Egypt, and Druids of Gaul, etc.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BY THE WAY ORPHEUS WAS\nAN INDIAN SAGE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus&nbsp; \u2013&nbsp; the\nIndian seer , a master musician and sitarist,&nbsp;\nthe holy man who brought Pythagoras to Kerala by ship and took him back\nvia Muzris ( Kodungallur\u2014 cultural centre of Calicut king&nbsp; ) Bernice&nbsp;\n( Red sea port of Egypt ) and Alexandria ( Egypt ) . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus was a Brahmachari , a celebate sage like\nApollonius , who was a veena virtuoso.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nVeena is the oldest musical instrument on the planet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herodotus had clearly\nwritten that Orpheus who would play divine string music and tame wild animals\ncame from India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus , a strict\nvegetarian introduced spirituality to Greece&nbsp;\n.&nbsp; He was known for the use of\nholy theertham from a copper bowl and a Tulsi ( basil) leaf which he used to\nkeep in his mouth .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cicero called Orpheus ,\nthe tawny hued , a devotee of Bacchus ( Krishna ) crowned with kissos ( Tulsi).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western historians and\nthe Pope blurred&nbsp; Jesus and Orpheus , and\npretty soon it was Jesus who was attributed to all the qualities of Orpheus \u2013\nenchanting wild animals with a 7 stringed lyre .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original sitar ( derived\nfrom the veena&nbsp; ) has seven strings&nbsp; which run over curved, raised frets ( Rudra /\nSaraswati veena) , and the remainder are sympathetic strings (tarb,&nbsp; taarif , tarafdaar) which run underneath the\nfrets and resonate in sympathy with the played strings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was Orpheus who gave\nPythagoras&nbsp; the mathematical relations of\nthe notes on the musical scale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The wisdom of the\nancients has been taught by the philosophers of Greece, but also by people called\nJews in Syria, and by Brahmins in India.\"--Megasthenes- 300 BC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus the tawny hued\nHindu Maharishi from Kerala, India gave music to the west.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before that their music\nconsisted of clanging rocks and shouting nonsense. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus also gave&nbsp; astrology and magic ( mantravadam ),&nbsp; vedic metaphysics ( magna grecia ) from\nKerala to the west.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus was a master in\nastrology, and all Greek astrology is though Orpheus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Greeks spliced on\nthe FAKE story of Eurydice to Orpheus, based on the MIRRORED version of ancient\nHindu myth of Savitri and Satyavan.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is about the\nefforts of Orpheus to retrieve his wife, Eurydice, (who was killed by a serpent\non their wedding night ) from the underworld. Orpheus went down to Hades to\nclaim her, and played so sweetly with his lute that Pluto allowed Eurydice to\nreturn to the earth with Orpheus, but on condition that he did not look behind\nhim until he had reached the terrestrial regions. Orpheus, however, in his\nanxiety to see if she were following him, looked round, and Eurydice\ndisappeared from his sight, instantly and forever. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This LOOKING BACK story\nis mirrored from the lore of Adi Shankaracharya bringing Devi to Kerala in 2000\nBC \u2014&nbsp; he looked back and Devi disappeared\nat the spot of Mookambika temple at Kollur Karnataka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras learnt\nmetempsychosis from India.&nbsp;\nMetempsychosis is the Greek equivalent of the 11000 year old Vedic Hindu\ndoctrine of transmigration of the soul, Karma and and reincarnation after\ndeath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost every Greek text\ntells that Orpheos was famous for Ahimsa or non-violence . In Euripides' play\nHippolytos a father taunts his son with the \"lifeless food\" he eats\nsince taking Orpheos for his \"king.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus is praised for\nhis knowledge of medicine and astrology ( ONLY Ayurveda and Indian astrology\nexisted those days).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Tredwell,\nApollonius travelled more extensively than any man of his age. \"That he\nwas a man of no mean account,\" Tredwell adds, \"is evident from his\nletters addressed to kings, rulers, philosophers societies and the first men of\nhis time, still extant, reserved in the works of Philostratus and Cujacius. &nbsp; Out\nof respect to Apollonius, his native birthplace of Tyana was regarded as a\nsacred city and was exempted from the jurisdiction of governors sent from Rome.\nGibbon, in his history of Rome, states that a superstitious reverence of the\ncountrymen of Apolloniua caused the emperor Claudius Aurelian (A. D. 273) to\ntreat with lenity the conquered city of Tyana\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cEmperor Hadrian, with\nreverent pomp, deposited Apollonius's writings in his splendid palace at\nAntium, whither pilgrims flocked daily in crowds to see them. . Lactantius says\nthat a statue of Apollonius was erected at Ephesus. Statues were erected to him\nin the temples and divine honors were paid him by the Emperors Caracella,\nAlexander Severus and Aurelain, while magical virtues were attributed to his\nname. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius was\neverywhere hailed as a god, and when he entered a city made converts as soon as\nseen. This was the case in Olympia, where the crowds paid more attention to him\nthan to the games, almost worshipping him. he followers of Apollonius, who were\ncalled Apollonians, continued to worship him until the fourth century. Many of\nthem wore the same dress as himself and adopted his Pythagorean vegetarian mode\nof living.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, Apollonius\nnever imposed his mode of life on others, even on his personal disciples, whom\nhe gave utmost freedom. Thus, he tells Damis that he has no wish to prohibit\nhim from eating flesh and drinking wine, though he demands the right to refrain\nhimself and of defending his conduct if called to do so. This is an indication\nthat Damis, who was the source of&nbsp;\nPhilostratus's information concerning the life and teachings of\nApollonius, was not a member of the inner circle of discipline, and therefore\nwas not in a position to communicate as much about his master as he otherwise\nwould have been able to do.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Pauline\nEpistles, which, in their original form, were undoubtedly written by Apollonius,\nDamis is referred to as \"Demas,\"- a companion of the apostle Admitting\nthat he was not permitted to enter the inner circle of his teacher and master,\nDamis refers to his manuscript on the \"Life, Journeyings and sayings of\nApollonius of Tyana,\" which later came into the possession of Empress Julia\nDomna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius founded a\nchurch and a community, composed of his disciples - who were undoubtedly the\nbranch of Essenes known as Nazarenes or Therapeuts. here is evidence that\nApollonius's \"church,\" whose adherents were known as\n\"Apolloniei\" survived for some centuries after his death, and\nconstituted the origin of what, after the Council of Nicea, was later\ntransformed into he Christian Church.) Nichomachus, and Tascius Victorianus all\nwrote lives of Apollonius Sidonius Apolinaris, who wrote his biography in the\nlast half of the fifth century, speaks of him as the favorite of monarchs and\nthe admiration of the countries he traversed. This same writer sent a copy of\nPhilostratus's \"Life of Apollonius of Tyana\" to his friend, Leo, the\nchancellor of a Frankish king at Toulouse, with this message:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Throw aside your\nendless labors and steal a respite from the burdens and bustle of the Court, so\nthat you may really study this long-expected volume as it deserves. When once\nabsorbed in it, you will wander with our Tyanean over Caucasus and Indus, to\nBrahmans of India and the naked philosophers of Nubia. It describes the life of\nvery much such a man as you are, with due respect to your Catholic faith.\nCourted by sovereigns, but never courting them; eager For knowledge; aloof from\nmoney-getting; fasting at feasts; linen-clad among wearers of purple; rebuking\nluxury; self-contained; plain-spoken; shock-headed in the midst of perfumed\nkings, who themselves were reeking with myrrh and malo-bathrum and polished\nwith pumice-stone; taking from the flocks nothing to eat or to wear; and\nnotwithstanding all these peculiarities not distrusted but honored wherever he\nwent throughout the world, and although royal treasures were placed at his\ndisposal, accepted from them merely those gifts to his friends which it suited\nhim better to bestow than to receive. In short, if we measure and weigh\nrealities, no philosopher's biography equal to this has ever appeared in the\ntimes of our ancestors; so far as I know; and I am certain that in my times it\nfinds a worthy reader in you.\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius was a man of\nextensive learning and the author of many books, all of which have been\ndestroyed by the Christians after 325 AD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apollonius was the\nauthor of the following books:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) \"The Mystic\nRites or Concerning Sacrifices.\" This treatise as mentioned by\nPhilostratus, who tells us that it sets down the proper method of sacrifice to\nevery god, the proper hours of prayer and offering. It was in wide circulation,\nand Philostratus had come across copies of it in the libraries and cities, and\nin the libraries of philosophers. Several fragments have been preserved and\nhave been found in the writings of Eusebius. &nbsp;Noack tells us that scholarship is convinced\nof the genuineness of this book, which was widely circulated and held in the\nhighest respect. It is said that its rules were engraved on brazen pillars at\nByzantium, which were melted down by the Christians.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) Four books entitled\n\"The Oracles or Concerning Divination.\" According to Philostratus,\nthe Full title was \"Divination of the Stars,\" and he says that it was\nbased on what Apollonius learned in India; but the kind of divination\nApollonius wrote about was&nbsp; not the\nordinary astrology, but something which Philostratus considers superior to\nordinary human art in such matters. He had, however, never heard of anyone\npossessing a copy of this rare book.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) \"The Life of\nPythagoras.\" Porphyry refers to this book, and Iamblicus quotes a long\npassage from it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) \"The Will of\nApollonius.\" This was written in the Ionic dialect, and contained a\nsummary of his doctrines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(5) \"A Hymn to\nMemory.\" (Eudocia speaks of many other works, all of which, including the\nones above described, were destroyed by the churchmen.) He was familiar with\nPlato, Pythagoras, Livy and Horace, as indicated by his frequent quotations\nfrom them; but his favorite author was Homer, and his philosophy was the\ndialectic stoicism of Zeno. He was the author of four books on Judicial\nAstrology and a treatise on Sacrifice, referred to by Eusebius and Suidas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emperor Marcus\nAurelius&nbsp; (A.D. 130) learned stoic\nphilosophy from Apollonius's writings. \"From Apollonius,\" said\nAurelius, \"I have learned freedom of will and understanding, steadiness of\npurpose, and to look to nothing else, not even for a moment, except to\nreason.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me tell you , The\nOld Testament belonged to the Armenian people&nbsp;\nand not to the Jews.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How many of you heard\nof the Armenian Genocide of 300,000 people in 1885, which was falsely blamed on\nthe Muslims ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
