font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WHITE CHRISTIAN LIES will NOT work in this\ninternet age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sack of Rome was\nNOT about pagan barbarians killing civilized Christians, but just the\nopposite.&nbsp; It was civilized and cultured\npagans being murdered and robbed by Christian barbarian hordes supported and\nfunded by the Pope from Vatican, with an offer of a royal palace as a Queen .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"></span></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Visigoths in Spain\nand southern Gaul, and the Ostrogoths in Italy were &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arian Christians. So too, the Vandals who\nplundered Gaul, Spain and North Africa were bible-toting Christian believers.\nNo Christian edifice was harmed during any of the sackings of Rome.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Never mind the bull of the Vatican\nhistorians.</span></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"></span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE TRUE DAMAGE TO GLORIOUS\nPAGAN ROME AND THE WEST WAS NOT DONE BY THE CHRISTIAN BARBARIAN VANDALS AND\nVISIGOTHS\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BUT BY THE CRIMINAL\nCHRISTIAN POPES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The true torchbearers\nduring the Dark Ages were pagans who kept alive pre-Christian teachings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Catholic Christians\n&nbsp;enforced a monopoly of thought.&nbsp; The white christiandom spent the Middle Ages\nin abject ignorance, regarded by Byzantines and Muslims alike as hopeless Philistines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pope Paul II, a\nnepotist and murderer, epitomised Western Christianity at the end of the\nmedieval period. &nbsp;&nbsp;Pope Paul II was a\ncommitted opponent of humanist learning. &nbsp;&nbsp;He approved the introduction of printing into\nthe Papal States, first at Subiaco in 1464 by Arnold Pannartz and Konrad\nSweynheim, and at Rome itself in 1467.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But these books were of\na narrow mindless band of Latin classical literature and ecclesiastical texts. Pope\nPaul II was the first Pope to enforce &nbsp;the\npractice of requiring Pagans to visibly identify themselves by wearing yellow\nhandkerchiefs in public, a process used later in Holocaust time.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1466 when\nPope Paul II, for the amusement of his Christian Roman citizens, forced Pagans\nand Jews &nbsp;to race naked through the\nstreets of &nbsp;Rome as a part of the Saturnalia\nfestival.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were made to drink lot of\nwater so that their bellies bounced and all Christians including the Pope\njeered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When in 1466 the\nhistorian Bartolomeo Platina commented on his ignorance,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His Holiness had him\nimprisoned and tortured. &nbsp;&nbsp;The same pope\nsuppressed the Roman Academy, which he thought encouraged paganism, and also\nbanned the reading of ancient poets by Roman children.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How great was Europe's\ncultural loss can be assessed by comparing the state of civilisation under the\nancient pagan Greeks ( who studied in Kerala , India or had visiting professors ) with that of Christendom at the close of the Middle Ages,\nalmost 2,000 years later. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Till the white man\ninvaded pagan India, he had NIL discoveries or inventions in his name.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1QlkHjCBzS0/Vvad0kkkF6I/AAAAAAABGto/vrY0xQvcaRA7WKLsxmAnxu-NtGqqcaLRw/s1600/StrappCado.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">Architecture:&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ancient pagan stone\nbuildings which that had been built extensively for private and public purposes\nwere now limited to military and ecclesiastical structures. &nbsp;&nbsp;Existing\npublic buildings (forums, libraries, odeons, theatres, museums, stadia,\nhippodromes, circuses, schools, gymnasia, temples, baths, Roman amphitheatres\netc.) were vandalised or destroyed. &nbsp;&nbsp;Many\npagan building techniques were forgotten. This is why you see sick looking monastry\ntype building in Rome.&nbsp; Every magnifienct\nstructure of ancient Rome and Greece were pagan.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Education:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-weight: bold;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n</span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n</span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where even the poor had\nbeen taught to read and write in pagan times. Many scholars sailed to India to\nstudy in Kodungallur University of Kerala. Education became a Church monopoly,\nand was denied to all except prospective priests and sons of the rich. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The syllabus was restricted to Christian\nindoctrination.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whatever the white Christian knew later was stolen from Arabs,\nwho bought \u201ctranslated to Arabic \u201c &nbsp;knowledge\nfrom Kerala with gold.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Stealing is one\none way lane \u2013never mind the white historians. We in India never had a concept\nof PATENTING knowledge. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several people came to\nIndia to get a cure for epilepsy and went back as intellectuals after stealing\nour intellectual rights. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras\nwas NOT even a mathematician. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">He came\nto Kerala by ship all the way from Greece 2500 years ago, to cure his\ndebilitating epilepsy with cannabis extract.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He hung around in the\nKerala School of Math , without understanding a anything, but he sure took\nnotes.&nbsp; He went back to Greece as the\nplanet\u2019s No 1 mathematician , thinker and a vegetarian to boot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One thing must be\nunderstood very clearly . &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;People in\nthe ancient days \u2013before&nbsp; Alexander the\nGreat came to India by ship. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;And the\nbiggest trade port was Calicut my hometown. &nbsp;&nbsp;People who tried to come in via the Hindu\nKhush mountains died a horrible death as the Bolan and Khyber passes were a\nclosely guarded secret.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras theorem was\ntoo simple for Kerala Mathematicians .&nbsp;\nThey could do the same thing via advanced Calculus. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now , an epileptic&nbsp; brain damaged MORON like Pythagoras could\nnever ever understand advanced Calculus\u2014&nbsp;\nnot even simple geometry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">100 years later Plato\nwould come to Kodungallur Univesity , Kerala by ship and learn for a few years\n.&nbsp; &nbsp;And then he went back as a greater cat than\nPythagoras\u2014 he was now the planet\u2019s No 1 THINKER !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Pythagoras and\nPlato had NOTHING original to offer to this planet \u2014 other than what they stole\nand patented in their own names .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras is now known\nas the first person on this planet to have taught the earth was spherical, with\nantipodes and that it revolved around the sun. Oh&nbsp; Boy!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Well I suggest you must\nread my post below. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/heliocentricity-versus-geocentricity.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/06/heliocentricity-versus-geocentricity.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fact that the earth\nis round ( BHOGOL ) was written in 7000 year old Rig Veda .&nbsp; Vamana avatar of Vishnu lifted the sphere of\nplanet earth on his tusks at least 25 milliniums milliniums before Rig Veda was\nwritten.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Greek Plato&nbsp; ( 427BC-347 BC ) went back from Kerala as a\nMathematician ( he was smarter than Pythogoras )&nbsp; and a philosopher.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He shared his spoils\nwith his mentor Socrates, and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle ( 384 BC-\n322 BC) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in Athens,\nthe first institution of higher learning in the Western world. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Socrates and Plato were\nhardcore homosexuals&nbsp; .&nbsp; &nbsp;Aristotle initiated Alexander the great into\nhomosexuality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus this gruesome\nHOMOSEXUAL TRIO&nbsp; of Plato, Socrates and\nAristotle laid the foundations of Western philosophy and science with stolen\nand patented Indian pagan knowledge .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras gave his\nstolen Ayurveda ( excerpts from treatises of Susruta and Charaka ) to the\ngrandfather of Hippocrates.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;In those days Greeks knew NOTHING of human\nanatomy and physiology because of the strict Greek taboo forbidding the\ndissection of human cadavers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hippocrates , the\nFATHER OF WESTERN MEDICINE tried to fudge 6200 year old Ayurveda and give it\nhis own spin. After all he was just a spin doctor, whose entire knowledge was\nfrom his grandfather.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Ayurvedic medicine,\nthere are 3 basic temperaments: Vata (gas), Pitta (bile) and Kapha (phlegm).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hippocrates ( 460BC-\n370 BC ) threw in one more most STUPID item ( blood\u2014TEE HEEE ) into the\nworks.&nbsp; For in the Sushruta Samhita, it\nis stated that blood ( Rakta ) , is a DHATU&nbsp;\nin Ayurveda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So his fudged treatise\ntalks about - bilious (bile), sanguineous (blood),&nbsp; phlegmatic (phlegm) and atrabiliary (black\nbile). &nbsp;And he removed Vata ( gas ) \u2013the\nmost important one.&nbsp; Show what an amazing\nidiot he is.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hippocrates the thief\ndid several more spins in medicine-- that body is made of water, air, earth and\nfire.&nbsp; He left out vaccum of Ayurveda .\nIn the Ayurvedic system, body is made of water, air, earth, fire and vacuum.\nDigestion is explained as cooking of food with the help of body-fire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hippocrates theory that\nthe human body is a microcosm of the universe is lifted from Ayurveda/\nUpanishads .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Information about Hippocrates\ncan also be found in the writings of Aristotle, which date from the 4th century\nBC.&nbsp; All newly qualified doctors take\nwhat is called the \u2018Hippocratic Oath\u2019- NOT knowing that he is NOT worth to take\nan oath on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Noting that Pythagoras\ngot himself healed of Epilepsy, Hippocrates was absolutely cock sure of stating\nthat epilepsy is NOT created by the Greek gods- and that like for every other\nillnesses it had a natural cause.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stupid Hippocrates\nwrote that raw food is bad.&nbsp; Cant blame\nhim, after all it was his grandfather who received third party stolen stuff. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hippocrates mistook the\nAyurvedic word&nbsp; AMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ayurvedic word for\ntoxins, ama, means, \"crude\" or \"raw\" - residues from faulty\nor incomplete pepsis that haven't been properly integrated into the body and\nits functioning, and therefore impede it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/fathers-of-surgery-and-medicine-4200-bc.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/fathers-of-surgery-and-medicine-4200-bc.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OK, FOLKS, TIMES HAS\nNOW COME TO BUST A BOMBSHELL WHICH IS GONNA SHIVER YOUR TIMBERS&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enter Orpheus&nbsp; \u2013&nbsp; the\nIndian seer , a master musician and sitarist,&nbsp;\nthe holy man who brought Pythagoras to Kerala by ship and took him back\nvia Muzris ( Kodungallur\u2014 cultural centre of Calicut king&nbsp; ) Bernice&nbsp;\n( Red sea port of Egypt ) and Alexandria ( Egypt ) . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus was a\nBrahmachari , a celebate sage who was a veena virtuoso.&nbsp;&nbsp; Veena is the oldest musical instrument on\nthe planet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealous Aristotle and\nPlato tried to paint him as a homosexual and a woman hater, which he was NOT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herodotus had clearly\nwritten that Orpheus who would play divine string music and tame wild animals\ncame from India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus , a strict\nvegetarian introduced spirituality to Greece&nbsp;\n.&nbsp; He was known for the use of\nholy theertham from a copper bowl and a Tulsi ( basil) leaf which he used to\nkeep in his mouth .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cicero called Orpheus ,\nthe tawny hued , a devotee of Bacchus ( Krishna ) crowned with kissos ( Tulsi).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western historians and\nthe Pope blurred&nbsp; Jesus and Orpheus , and\npretty soon it was Jesus who was attributed to all the qualities of Orpheus \u2013\nenchanting wild animals with a 7 stringed lyre .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original sitar (\nderived from the veena&nbsp; ) has seven\nstrings&nbsp; which run over curved, raised\nfrets ( Rudra / Saraswati veena) , and the remainder are sympathetic strings\n(tarb,&nbsp; taarif , tarafdaar) which run\nunderneath the frets and resonate in sympathy with the played strings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was Orpheus who gave\nPythagoras&nbsp; the mathematical relations of\nthe notes on the musical scale.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The wisdom of the\nancients has been taught by the philosophers of Greece, but also by people\ncalled Jews in Syria, and by Brahmins in India.\"\u2014Pagan <b>Megasthenes- 300 BC.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus the tawny hued\nHindu Maharishi from Kerala, India gave music to the west.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before that their music\nconsisted of clanging rocks and shouting nonsense. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus also gave&nbsp; astrology and magic ( mantravadam ),&nbsp; vedic metaphysics ( magna grecia ) from\nKerala to the west.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus was a master in\nastrology, and all Greek astrology is though Orpheus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Greeks spliced on\nthe FAKE story of Eurydice to Orpheus, based on the MIRRORED version of ancient\nHindu myth of Savitri and Satyavan.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is about the\nefforts of Orpheus to retrieve his wife, Eurydice, (who was killed by a serpent\non their wedding night ) from the underworld. Orpheus went down to Hades to\nclaim her, and played so sweetly with his lute that Pluto allowed Eurydice to\nreturn to the earth with Orpheus, but on condition that he did not look behind\nhim until he had reached the terrestrial regions. Orpheus, however, in his\nanxiety to see if she were following him, looked round, and Eurydice\ndisappeared from his sight, instantly and forever. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This LOOKING BACK story\nis mirrored from the lore of Adi Shankaracharya bringing Devi to Kerala in 2000\nBC \u2014&nbsp; he looked back and Devi disappeared\nat the spot of Mookambika temple at Kollur Karnataka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pythagoras learnt\nmetempsychosis from India.&nbsp;\nMetempsychosis is the Greek equivalent of the 11000 year old Vedic Hindu\ndoctrine of transmigration of the soul, Karma and and reincarnation after\ndeath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost every Greek text\ntells that Orpheus was famous for Ahimsa or non-violence . In Euripides' play\nHippolytos a father taunts his son with the \"lifeless food\" he eats\nsince taking Orpheus for his \"king.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orpheus is praised for\nhis knowledge of medicine and astrology ( ONLY Ayurveda and Indian astrology\nexisted those days).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/mihira-muni-great-astrologer-cum.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/mihira-muni-great-astrologer-cum.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name of India, so\nfar as is known, appears in Greek literature in the 5th century B.C. in the\nworks of Hekataios and Herodotos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Herodotos of\nHalikarnassos (484-425 B. C.) whose histories have survived in their entirety\nhad written clearly about India .&nbsp;&nbsp;\nHerodotos writes about India's population, saying that the Indians are\n\"more in number than any nation known to me.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He goes to great\ndetails while telling of Kerala\u2019s&nbsp; wealth\nin gold; He tells about&nbsp; Indian birds and\nbeasts he regards as much bigger than those existing elsewhere, except for\nhorses. Indian clothing he describes as made from wool growing on trees (i.e.\ncotton) and the amazing thin cotton Calico cloth , we use in Kerala as Mundu (\ndhoti ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many Indian seers\nvisited Greece , as in 7000 BC, India ruled Palistan ( Palestine ) . Once when\nSocrates was asked by an Indian seer, what he does for a living . When Socrates\nreplied that he \"investigated human life,\" the Indian laughed aloud ,\nsaying that \"no one was able to observe human affairs if he was ignorant\nof divine matters and consciousness .\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vegetarianism in Greece\nis called Orphikos bios, or \"Orphic way of life\". &nbsp;&nbsp;Only Indians were vegetarians those days.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Orpeheus and the\nconverted Pythagoras forbade the sacrifice of animals\u2014so there goes the western\ntheory of animal sacrifice in Indian temples.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote ( I\nusually do NOT care for such third party references ) of the parallels between\nthe Orphic path and the yogic as written by Joseph John Campbell :&nbsp; \u201ca system both of thought and practice,\nexactly paralleling that of Indian asceticism, was communicated by initiated\nmasters to little circles of devotees. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul, it was\ndeclared, returned repeatedly to life, bound to the wheel of rebirth (compare\nthe Sanskrit samsara).&nbsp; Through\nasceticism (Sanskrit, tapas), however, the body could be purged of its Titan\ndross (Sanskrit, mirjara, \u2018shedding\u2019) and the soul released (Sanskrit, moksha,\n\u2018release\u2019). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also, rituals fostering\nmeditation on the godly factor were of help (Sanskrit, bhakti,\n\u2018devotion\u2019).&nbsp; And when, at last, in\nrapture (samadhi), the initiate cleaved to his own intrinsic being\n(svasvarupman), he was divine (Shivaham, \u2018I am Shiva.\u2019)\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gay side kick of\nAristotle wrote : \u201c Orpheus so hated women he chose to be reborn as a\nmotherless swan\u201d&nbsp; .&nbsp; It is a pity that he visited India , yet he\nknew nothing of Brahmacharya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However Plato respects\nOrpheus for his poetry ,the sweet hymns&nbsp;\nof the hexameter form that revolutionized Greek poetry.&nbsp;&nbsp; For Greek / Latin classics Homer's Iliad and\nOdyssey and Virgil's Aeneid have inherent the Dactylic hexameter ( heroic\nhexameter)&nbsp; a form of meter in poetry or\na rhythmic scheme, like the metered Sanskrit verses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mysterious The\nTestament of Orpheus was the most important Orphic document for six centuries\nafter it\u2019s \u201cdiscovery\u201d circa 300 AD.&nbsp; In\nit Orpheus says when in Egypt he met Moses who taught him about monotheism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A circa 350 AD hematite\nmagic amulet, once in the collection of the Berlin Museum, depicted a man\ncrucified on a cross with a moon and seven stars above his head and the words\nOrpheoc Bakkikoc.&nbsp; It was declared to be\na forgery by a furious pope Pius XII.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Orphic doctrine was\npurely vedic Indian and&nbsp; remained on a\nmythological plane, interpreting the universe in terms of personalized deities\nand procreation. Pythagoras refined and rationalized it and grabbed the glory\nlater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Indian Christian\ntrader named Theophilos, from originally from Kerala and resident in Socotra\nisland ( Aloe vera trade ) undertook several missionary journeys on behalf of\nthe Roman emperor Constantius in the mid-4th century.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;He\nwrites of a small Christian community in on the Malabar coast which traces its\norigins to Jesus' disciples Thomas and&nbsp;\nBartholomew. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bartholomew is one of\nthe 12 disciples of Jesus and ismentioned in three Synoptic gospels:\nMatthew,[10:1\u20134] Mark,[3:13\u201319] and Luke,[6:12\u201316] and also appears as one of\nthe witnesses of the Ascension[Acts 1:4,12,13]; however, each time he is named\nin the company of Philip.&nbsp; He is not\nmentioned in Gospel of John.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the mid-6th century\nthe Alexandrian merchant Kosmas Indikopleustes (India-navigator- TEE HEEEE ) is\nreputed to have visited the Malabar coast and Ceylon.&nbsp; Kosmas was the author of a stolen\nworld-geography and a book on stolen Kerala astronomy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">Dance:</span></b> <span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dance was prohibited as\npagan by the Christian church and tending to promote lust.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Democracy:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Democracy was condemned\nas un-Christian, since the Bible presupposed kingdoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>History:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Factual history was\nreplaced by fabrications and propaganda (such as \u201clegends\u201d), except for\nsympathetic chronicles that did not reflect badly on the Church. Unsympathetic\nor objective histories were \"lost\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Law:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Law was converted from\nan instrument of justice to a system featuring trials by ordeal, frequently\nserving the interests of the Church and denying the principles of natural\njustice. Inequality was a fundamental principle of ecclesiastical law. &nbsp;Pope was always right. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Literature:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All literature,\nincluding the Bible, was banned to the population at large. The few who were allowed\nto learn to read were restricted to prayer books and Christian Legends\npresented as fact. &nbsp;&nbsp;Pagan books of knowledge\nwere hidden by the church and then many popes with NIL educational foundation, claimed to be the authors of this\nknowledge.&nbsp; The funny thing was all this\nknowledge was available in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Mathematics&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was limited within\nthe Church to the arithmetic necessary to calculate the date of Easter.\nOtherwise it was treated with suspicion or hostility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Medicine:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All medical progress\nwas halted. Illness was considered to be a punishment for sin. Hygiene and\npublic health were abandoned as unchristian<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span>\n</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Music &amp; Singing:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music and singing were restricted\nto Church music or choir singing . Otherwise they were regarded as pagan satanic.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;Classical opera died out under the\nChristian hegemony \u2014 it was re-introduced in the sixteenth century.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Natural history: :&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The study of nature,\npopular in the ancient world, stagnated until the Enlightenment. Research was\nsuppressed until then because the Church insisted on a literal interpretation\nof the Bible and its infallibility as a handbook of all world knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Painting and Art:&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All representation was\nfirst banned, then restricted to religious themes from the fifth century. All existing\nnon-Christian art was destroyed . The rules of perspective, known in ancient\ntimes, were \u201clost\u201d until rediscovered by Brunelleschi at the dawn of the\nRenaissance. &nbsp;In 1563, the Council of\nTrent confirmed Art as a conformist naturalistic propaganda tool.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Philosophy:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Church monopoly was\nestablished. The subject was then reduced to scholasticism. Existing marvelous pagan\nphilosophical works were destroyed. Genuine philosophers were censored,\npersecuted and killed. &nbsp;No significant\nprogress (except by \u201cheretics\u201d) was to take place from the murder of Hypatia\nuntil Cosimo de\" Medici revived ancient philosophy with his Platonic\nAcademy in Florence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Public Service:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The charitable\nendowment of public buildings (schools, libraries, theatres, sports stadia,\nbaths, horse racing cources, etc.) ceased almost completely when the Church\nenjoyed total control. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Almost every\nvillage in Europe has a medieval church, generally built in better materials\nthan any other local building. A vanishingly small number have comparable\nchurch built schools, hospitals or other useful public buildings. The first\nmodern public library was founded by Cosimo de\" Medici, \u201cgodfather\u201d to the\nRenaissance<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Sculpture:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-religious sculpture\nceased to be produced. The best examples from antiquity were \"lost\".\nInferior material was produced for the Church, generally for propaganda\npurposes. Nothing comparable in quality to classical work was produced until\nthe Renaissancet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Sport:&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sports were suppressed,\nalong with international sporting events. They were replaced by various kinds\nof animal torture and pastimes too local to be controlled by the Church.\nBullfighting was a Christian sport.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Theatre:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acting was banned,\nexcept for propaganda purposes: religious ceremonies, mystery plays and\nmorality plays.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Public Health:</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Public baths,\nsophisticated aquaducts and sewers were all destroyed or allowed to fall into\ndesuetude (the only exception being baths which were preserved in monasteries\nfor the use of monks)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Infrastructure&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Streets and viaducts\nwere used but not maintained. They survived into secular times only because\nthey had been so well built.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SINCE CHRISTIANITY TOOL\nOVER WESTERN LANDS, THERE WERE NO INVENTIONS/ DISCOVERIES ( EXCEPT STOLEN FROM\nARABS , WHO BOUGHT TRANSLATED KNOWLEDGE FROM KERALA FOR GOLD ) TILL THE WHITE\nMAN INVADED INDIA.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIANS TEXTS IN\nSANSKRIT MALAYALAM WERE TRANSLATED AND KNOWLEDGE STOLEN AND PATENTED.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOW GERMANY\nUNIVERSITIES LEARN SANSKRIT AND MALAYALAM FOR THOUSANDS OF ANCIENT BOOKS REMAIN\nIN GERMANY THANKS TO GERMAN JEW ROTHSCHILD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/12/we-are-hindus-we-are-indians-we-are.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/12/we-are-hindus-we-are-indians-we-are.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/12/hermann-gundert-hermann-hesse-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/12/hermann-gundert-hermann-hesse-and.html</a></span></span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The 5th to 15th centuries, are a period of\n1000 years &nbsp;Vatican Church induced intellectual\ndarkness between extinguishing the \"light of Rome\" after the end of\nLate Antiquity, and the rise of the Italian Renaissance in the 15th century.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The white man reached India in 1498 AD at Calicut ( Vaso Da Gama my hometown) .\n&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">After that the DIMWIT white man SUDDENLY\nbecame HAJAAAAR SMART -- &nbsp;after 1000 years of PATHETIC &nbsp;NOTHING !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qdk9-5VjOqk/Vva-vQ2nSVI/AAAAAAABGuE/tJKqpee4wa0qEtbH_8TPof3L5KRUH1J9w/s1600/78090EE53.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"388\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qdk9-5VjOqk/Vva-vQ2nSVI/AAAAAAABGuE/tJKqpee4wa0qEtbH_8TPof3L5KRUH1J9w/s400/78090EE53.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"></span></b>\n<b style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For one millennium the Roman Catholic Church\ncontrolled religion, philosophy, morals, politics, art and education. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This was the dark age for the western lands.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nobody had the quality to take over from\nwhere the PAGAN ( HINDU ) INTELLECTUALS left off.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">LET US CHECK OUT THE 1100 YEARS OF\nCONTRIBUTIONS BY THE CHRISTIAN WHITE MAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Mass as a daily\ncelebration; 394<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Beginning of the\nexaltation of Mary, the term \"Mother of God\" first applied to her by\nthe Council of Ephesus; 431<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Priests began to dress\ndifferently from laymen; 500<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Extreme Unction; 526<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The doctrine of\nPurgatory, established by Gregory I; 593<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Latin Language, used in\nprayer and worship, imposed by Gregory I; 600<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Prayers directed to\nMary, dead saints and angels; about 600<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Title of pope, or\nuniversal bishop, given to Boniface III by emperor Phocas; 610<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kissing the pope s\nfoot, began with pope Constantine; 709<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Temporal power of the\npopes, conferred by Pepin, king of France; 750<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Worship of the cross,\nimages and relics, authorized in; 786<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Holy water, mixed with\na pinch of salt and blessed by a priest; 850<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Worship of St. Joseph;\n890<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">College of Cardinals\nestablished; 927<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Baptism of bells,\ninstituted by pope John XIV; 965<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Canonization of dead\nsaints, first by pope John XV; 995<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Fasting of Fridays and\nduring lent; 998<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Mass, developed\ngradually as a sacrifice, attendance made obligatory in the 11th century<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Celibacy of the\npriesthood, decreed by pope Gregory VII (Hildebrand); 1079<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Rosary, mechanical\npraying with beads, invented by Peter the Hermit; 1090<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Inquisition,\ninstituted by the Council of Verona; 1184<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sale of Indulgences;\n1190<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Transubstantiation,\nproclaimed by pope Innocent III; 1215<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Auricular Confession of\nsins to a priest instead of to God, instituted by pope Innocent III, in Lateran\nCouncil; 1215<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Adoration of the wafer\n(Host), decreed by pope Honorius III; 1220<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bible forbidden to\nlaymen, placed on the Index of Forbidden Books by the Council of Valencia; 1229<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Scapular, invented\nby Simon Stock, an English monk; 1287<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Cup forbidden to the\npeople at communion by Council of Constance; 1414<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Purgatory proclaimed as\na dogma by the Council of Florence; 1438<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The doctrine of Seven\nSacraments affirmed; 1439<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Ave Maria (part of\nthe last half was completed 50 years later and approved by pope Sixtus V at the\nend of the 16th century); 1508<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Jesuit order founded by\nLoyola; 1534</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
